articles.title: Apple Has 'Flex The Muscles Moment' With iPhone 15, Expects 'Mini Supercycle' To Propel Shares Forward
articles.content:
A leading Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) analyst broke down the key takeaways from Tuesday’s company event that highlighted upcoming product launches such as the iPhone 15.
The Apple Analyst: Wedbush analyst Daniel Ives had an Outperform rating on Apple and a price target of $230.
Related Link: iPhone 15 Vs. iPhone 14: The Seven Biggest Changes And One Surprise
The Analyst Takeaways: On Tuesday, Apple unveiled the highly anticipated iPhone 15, with several models and price points to come, with preorders starting on Friday, Sept. 15.
“iPhone 15 flex the muscles moment for Cupertino,” Ives said in an updated note Tuesday.
The analyst said the iPhone was the main event, but the Apple Watch highlights at the event were important as it had “transformed to a meaningful product segment for Apple.”
“The iPhone 15 launch comes off the heels as Apple further penetrates its large ecosystem and we also believe ASPs are bumping up towards a roughly $900/$925 with a heavier Pro mix shift for the iPhone 15 setting up a new ‘mini supercycle’ despite the ...Full story available on Benzinga.com

articles.title: As T-bill yields climb, Fed's reverse repo facility shrinks to lowest level in 1½ years
articles.content: Yields on Treasury bills are well above 5%, eclipsing the rate investors earn by parking cash at the Federal Reserve's reverse repo program.

articles.content: As expected, Apple (AAPL) unveiled the new iPhone 15 and Watch 9 series today.

articles.title: Dow snaps three-day win streak as Apple unveils iPhone 15, with U.S. inflation data looming
articles.content: U.S. stocks close lower Tuesday, a day that had Apple unveiling its iPhone 15 and investors looking ahead to August inflation from the consumer-price index on Wednesday.

articles.title: Apple to drop plastic packaging by end of next year, no leather cases for iPhone15
articles.content: iPhone15 launch features green efforts, including a faster shift from plastic and leather. Analyst thinks Apple needs to be a bigger sustainability disruptor.

articles.title: Disney/Charter Cable Deal Is a Win-Win
articles.content: Charter gets access to streaming apps for subscribers, and Disney paved a path to the future. This is a win-win for everyone.

articles.title: Apple iPhone 15, New Watch, Carbon Neutral Products: Everything Apple Just Announced
articles.content:
Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) announced a plethora of products and features at the Wonderlust event on Tuesday. From revamped AirPods Pro to carbon-neutral Apple Watches and a new lineup of iPhones, here’s a rundown of all the announcements.
AirPods Pro (2nd generation)

Charging and Convenience: The case now has USB‑C and MagSafe charging capabilities, meaning users can use one cable to charge multiple Apple devices. The iPhone 15 series — also with USB-C port — can directly charge the AirPods.
Performance and Experience: Double the Active Noise Cancellation, a more advanced Transparency mode, immersive Spatial Audio and a broader range of ear tip sizes.
New Features: The new AirPods will be dust resistant and support Lossless Audio with Apple Vision Pro. Plus, with ...

articles.title: Apple unveils iPhone 15 lineup, increases base price on highest-end model for first time
articles.content: Apple dropped the cheapest configuration of its Pro Max version in an effective price hike on that model.

articles.title: S&P 500’s tech stocks slump, with Apple event failing to provide boost to the sector
articles.content: The S&P 500’s information technology sector wasn’t getting any help from Apple Inc. on Tuesday afternoon, after the tech giant’s highly-anticipated marketing event.
